llm.feedback: Your draft is on the right track but needs tightening to meet Argos’ standards. Add a concrete 10‑yr Treasury yield figure (e.g., 4.48% as of 27 Aug 2025) and show the 1‑bp‑to‑0.5‑bp rule linking it to mortgage rates; cite LF0UUL917. Specify the Fed’s policy stance (5.25% funds rate, no cuts announced) and the balance‑sheet contraction size (≈$7.5 trn) to quantify the “upward pressure.” Give a precise catalyst window: the next FOMC meeting (16‑17 Sept 2025) and any Fed‑rate‑change signals. State the base‑case range (6.5‑7.5 %) and the horizon (until Sept 2025, then potential 6.0‑6.5 % if a pivot). Add a risk matrix: (1) Fed hike → +0.5‑1 bp mortgage rise; (2) inflation spike → +0.5‑1 bp; (3) debt‑market shock → +0.5‑1 bp; (4) Fed pivot → –0.5‑1 bp. End with a confidence rating (moderate) and a clear, concise causal chain: Fed policy → 10‑yr yield → mortgage rates. This will satisfy the acceptance gate (handle ust10y, sign +, magnitude, catalyst) and improve depth, specificity, and actionable guidance.
